intro: Syngonanthus longipes var. pilosus, commonly known as the hairy long-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, often clustered leaves. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its dense, hairy foliage and pale green to yellowish-green leaves. It typically attaches itself to the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients from them. This variant is noted for its unique morphological features and ecological role in its native habitat.
